intro: Tagetes integrifolia, commonly known as the Mexican marigold or the narrow-leaved marigold, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to Mexico and Central America, characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its foliage is often aromatic, containing compounds that have been used in traditional medicine. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
